context:
Turnabout Big Top









TranscriptPart 1

Part 2

Part 3

Part 4December 30, 9:41 AMDistrict CourtDefendant Lobby No. 5Maya:
Good morning, Max.Max:
Oh... Yeah... Good morning, sweeties...Phoenix:
You don't seem like your usual sparkling self today. (Changed from [You don't seem like you're [sic] usual sparkling self today.] in the original release)Max:
I'm always like this before I go in front of an audience... I'm working up to it.???:
Tee hee...Regina:
Don't get nervous, Maxy... Here, have a glass of milk.Maya:
R-Regina!!Max:
How fabulous!! My sweetie pie!! My sweetie pie princess!! You came to watch my performance today?Regina:
Of course I did! Moe told me that I should come and watch this.Phoenix:
(Moe said that...?)Regina:
So, what kind of performance will you put on today? Lemme guess, you'll fly at the end?Max:
Uh... It's not kind of show... Isn't that right, my sweeties?Maya:
Huh?Max:
I think my sweetie pie princess doesn't...Phoenix:
Yeah. She doesn't seem to realize what's going on... Or even where she is...Max:
Hmm...Regina:
Well, Max, it looks like it's time to raise the curtain. I'll see you later. Today I'm just a member of the audience!Max:
F-Fabulous! Enjoy yourself out there!!Regina:
Good luck, Max! You're the best!!Maya:
Regina's different, don't you think, Nick?Moe:
Top of the morning to ya! Everybody... Let's get ready to get stuck in legal limbo! How low can you go?Phoenix:
M-Moe.Moe:
Top of the morning to ya, guv'ner.Phoenix:
Uhh... Top of the morning.Moe:
That's the ticket! Attacking the day starts with energy in the morning! The early bird gets the worm. But then again, worms lack higher brain function. Aha! Aha! Aha! Aha! Here Max! I brought you a present! Have some milk.Max:
Oh, my! Th-Thanks... (Changed from [Oh my! Thank you!!] in the original release)Moe:
So how are you today, Wright?Phoenix:
Well... I've got the feeling that today I'm going to face off against the real culprit. (Changed from [Well... I've got the feeling that today I'm going to face off against the real criminal.] in the original release)Moe:
You mean Acro?Maya:
Huh!? You think he did it...?Moe:
Be careful... He's used to putting his life on the line. Literally. He's got guts to spare.Phoenix:
If all I've got to worry about is how thin the tightrope is, I'm used to it already... It just means that I won't be able to press him like I can other witnesses...Maya:
What are you going to do then, Nick!?Phoenix:
I guess today we'll just have to do without our psychological warfare. Today we rely on evidence. It's the only way we'll get past Acro and to the truth.Maya:
You're right... But it's gonna be tough...Moe:
Anyways... I want you to make sure that Regina see it all today. It's important. Then she'll finally have to deal with the reality of what happened to her father.Maya:
You want us to make sure Regina watches?Moe:
Yes. That's why I brought her here to court today.Max:
What's that supposed to mean?Moe:
She need to know that when people die, they don't just become stars. I may be an old-fashioned clown, but I don't believe in people becoming stars.December 30, 10:00 AMDistrict CourtCourtroom No. 2Judge:
Court is now in session for the trial of Maximillion Galactica. (Changed from [The court is now in session in the trial of Maximillion Galactica.] in the original release)von Karma:
The prosecution is ready, Your Honor.Phoenix:
The defense is ready, Your Honor.Judge:
Very well. Ms. von Karma, you may proceed with your case.von Karma:
The prosecution would like to revise its previous theory of events. (Changed from [The prosecution would like to revise it's [sic] previous theory of events.] in the original release)Judge:
What's the meaning of this?von Karma:
We have discovered a new witness. Or shall I say, a new eyewitness. One that saw Maximillion Galactica fly off from the scene of the crime.Judge:
Order! Order! I had a feeling something like this would come up...von Karma:
Due to this revision, we are now prepared to explain how the defendant flew that night. An explanation the prosecution will present if the need so [sic] arises... In fact, my detective stayed up all night creating a mockup of the scene, on my orders.Phoenix:
(Poor Gumshoe...)Judge:
Very well... Please call your witness to the stand!Phoenix:
(Time to get to work! Or shall I say, time to walk the courtroom tightrope...)von Karma:
Name and occupation.Acro:
Ken Dingling, but everyone calls me Acro. I'm employed as an acrobat at the Berry Big Circus.von Karma:
Where were you the night of the crime?Acro:
I was in my room that night.von Karma:
If you look at the map, you will see the witness' room is near the crime scene.Acro:
My room is on the third floor. The crime scene is below my window.Judge:
Hmm...von Karma:
The night of the crime, the witness saw something quite shocking. Would you tell us what you witnessed?Acro:
OK...Witness Testimony-- What You Witnessed --Acro:
It was just after 10:00 PM, and I was resting in my bed.
Around that time, I heard a large "THUMP" noise from outside the window.
Then a few moments later, I saw someone... flying... Right by my window.
It was Max Galactica... I only saw him from behind, but that's who it looked like.
To be honest, when I saw that, I thought I was dreaming...Judge:
Hmm... This witness's testimony matches up exactly with that of the clown.von Karma:
If that's the case, there is very little the prosecution need add... All that's left is to explain how the defendant disappeared into the sky that night.Phoenix:Phoenix:
Before we get that far, I'd like to cross-examine the witness.von Karma:
A foolish choice by a foolish fool who wishes to feel the foolish sadness of a sad fool. A man must know the proper timing for things, Mr. Phoenix Wright. Just like your old friend, Mr. Miles Edgeworth did.Phoenix:
...Judge:
Mr. Wright. Do you have a problem with the witness' testimony?Phoenix:
In the words of Ms. von Karma, may I quote yesterday's proceedings... "There's no way that actually happened!"Judge:
Very well... You may proceed with your cross-examination.Cross Examination

characters.name: Maya Fey
characters.description1: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain tradition of spirit channeling.

characters.name: Dick Gumshoe
characters.description1: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.

characters.name: Franziska von Karma
characters.description1: A prosecutor in Germany since age 13, she has come to America to defeat me in court.

characters.name: Max
characters.description1: A "fabulous" magician famed for his aerial illusions. Accused of murder.

characters.name: Regina Berry
characters.description1: The idol of the Berry Big Circus and daughter to Russel Berry, the Ringmaster.

characters.name: Russell Berry
characters.description1: The victim and Ringmaster of the Berry Big Circus. Regina Berry's father.

characters.name: Ben
characters.description1: Real Name: Benjamin Woodman. A ventriloquist. Conversing with him is really tiring.
characters.description2: Real Name: Benjamin Woodman. Without his puppet Trilo, Ben won't say much.

characters.name: Moe
characters.description1: Real Name: Lawrence Curls. The Ringmaster's old friend, a pleasant stooge of a clown.

characters.name: Acro
characters.description1: Real Name: Ken Dingling. A star acrobat currently undergoing rehabilitation.
characters.description2: Real Name: Ken Dingling. Seriously injured both legs while training six months ago.

characters.name: Bat
characters.description1: Real Name: Sean Dingling. Bit on the head six months ago by Léon. Still in a coma.

evidence_objects.name: Attorney's Badge
evidence_objects.description1: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

evidence_objects.name: Maya's Magatama
evidence_objects.description1: Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.

evidence_objects.name: Crime Photo
evidence_objects.description1: A picture of the crime scene. Click here for details.

evidence_objects.name: Silk Hat
evidence_objects.description1: Made-to-order fedora that is a symbol of Max's fabulousness. Found at the crime scene.

evidence_objects.name: Max G. Promo Poster
evidence_objects.obtained: Received from the Big Top - Ringmaster's Room.
evidence_objects.description1: Emblazoned with Max's three famous symbols. Click here for details.

evidence_objects.name: Ringmaster's Papers
evidence_objects.obtained: Received from the Big Top - Ringmaster's Room.
evidence_objects.description1: Documents related to Max's salary negotiations. He got an enormous raise 1 week ago.

evidence_objects.name: Circus Map
evidence_objects.description1: A map of the Berry Big Circus. Click here for details.

evidence_objects.name: Broken Bottle
evidence_objects.obtained: Retrieved from the Big Top - Cafeteria.
evidence_objects.description1: An orange juice bottle that was found broken on the cafeteria floor.

evidence_objects.name: Trilo Quist
evidence_objects.obtained: Retrieved from the Big Top - Ringmaster's Room.
evidence_objects.description1: A ventriloquist's puppet. An operatic tenor who doubles as Ben's sidekick.

evidence_objects.name: Money the Monkey
evidence_objects.description1: A monkey who takes care of Acro. Habitually gathers all sorts of shiny objects.

evidence_objects.name: Ring
evidence_objects.description1: A cheap ring with an eerie sparkle. "From T to R" is engraved on it.

evidence_objects.name: Russell's Autopsy Report
evidence_objects.obtained: Submitted as evidence by Detective Gumshoe.
evidence_objects.description1: Time of death: 10:15 PM. Cause: Blunt force trauma to the back of the head.

evidence_objects.name: Wooden Box
evidence_objects.obtained: Submitted as evidence by Detective Gumshoe.
evidence_objects.description1: The victim was hunched over this 20 lb. box. It was locked by a small key.

evidence_objects.name: Small Seasoning Bottle
evidence_objects.obtained: Submitted as evidence by Detective Gumshoe.
evidence_objects.description1: Found inside the Wooden Box the victim was hunched over. It contains pepper.

evidence_objects.name: Grand Prix Photo
evidence_objects.description1: Photo of Max's Award Ceremony. Click here for details.

evidence_objects.name: Max G. Bust
evidence_objects.obtained: Retrieved from the Big Top - Cafeteria.
evidence_objects.description1: Bronze statue taken from the cafeteria before the crime. Click here for details.

evidence_objects.name: Note
evidence_objects.obtained: Received from Moe.  → Retrieved from the Big Top - Ringmaster's Room.
evidence_objects.description1: Posted in the Cafeteria on the day of the crime, then torn. States: "To The Murderer!"
evidence_objects.description2: Torn by Ringmaster, found in his tailcoat pocket. Click here for details.
evidence_objects.description3: Found in Regina's pocket on the morning of crime. Click here for details.
evidence_objects.description4: Placed by Acro in Regina's pocket on morning of crime. Click here for details.

evidence_objects.name: Stage Costume
evidence_objects.description1: A shiny spangled vest. It's not Maya's size at all.

evidence_objects.name: Léon
evidence_objects.description1: The animal show's lion. Shot by the Ringmaster six months ago for biting a performer.

evidence_objects.name: Scarf
evidence_objects.description1: Bat's scarf. Stained with his blood and a small quantity of pepper.

testimonies.testimony: It was just after 10:00 PM, and I was resting in my bed.
Around that time, I heard a large "THUMP" noise from outside the window.
Then a few moments later, I saw someone... Flying... Right by my window.
It was Max Galactica... I only saw him from behind, but that's who it looked like.
To be honest, when I saw that, I thought I was dreaming...

characters.name: Maya Fey
characters.description1: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain tradition of spirit channeling.

characters.name: Dick Gumshoe
characters.description1: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.

characters.name: Franziska von Karma
characters.description1: A prosecutor in Germany since age 13, she has come to America to defeat me in court.

characters.name: Max
characters.description1: A "fabulous" magician famed for his aerial illusions. Accused of murder.

characters.name: Regina Berry
characters.description1: The idol of the Berry Big Circus and daughter to Russel Berry, the Ringmaster.

characters.name: Russell Berry
characters.description1: The victim and Ringmaster of the Berry Big Circus. Regina Berry's father.

characters.name: Ben
characters.description1: Real Name: Benjamin Woodman. A ventriloquist. Conversing with him is really tiring.
characters.description2: Real Name: Benjamin Woodman. Without his puppet Trilo, Ben won't say much.

characters.name: Moe
characters.description1: Real Name: Lawrence Curls. The Ringmaster's old friend, a pleasant stooge of a clown.

characters.name: Acro
characters.description1: Real Name: Ken Dingling. A star acrobat currently undergoing rehabilitation.
characters.description2: Real Name: Ken Dingling. Seriously injured both legs while training six months ago.

characters.name: Bat
characters.description1: Real Name: Sean Dingling. Bit on the head six months ago by Léon. Still in a coma.

testimonies.testimony: I suppose I could have lifted something the size of that bust.
I have a strong upper body from working as an acrobat, and only my legs were injured.
However, lifting the bust and looking out of the window would've been impossible.
There's no way I could have exerted that kind of force on my lower body.
That makes it impossible for me to have known the location of the Ringmaster's head.
Thus it would be unrealistic to drop the bust on him. Don't you think?
